name: Clin N Distal Bile Duct
title: Clinical N
notes:
**Note:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Regional lymph nodes**

    Cystic duct (node of the neck of the gallbladder) (Calot's node)
    Hepatic artery
    Hilar (in the hepatoduodenal ligament)
    Node of the foramen of Winslow (omental) (epiploic)
    Pancreaticoduodenal:
        Anterior
        Posterior
    Pericholedochal (node along common bile duct)
    Periduodenal
    Peripancreatic (near head of pancreas only)
    Periportal
    Porta hepatis (portal) (hilar) (in hilus of liver)
    Superior mesenteric artery
    Superior mesenteric vein
rows: Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed

Clinical classification criteria met, evaluation done: 
    Physician unable to assess N
    Regional lymph node involvement cannot be determined or findings inconclusive
Physician assigns cNX, no other information available to determine N

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1

Primary site/histology not TNM defined
Death certificate only (DCO) case

Clinical classification criteria not met
Clinical classification criteria met, evaluation done:
    No information about diagnostic workup
    Results not documented in record
Tumor first detected on surgical resection (no clinical workup)
Evidence of metastatic disease [(cM1) or (pM1)], no other workup
Only Clinical Stage Group documented (no T, N, or M information available)
